bugs.title: CVE-2020-25698 moodle: Teacher is able to unenrol users without permission using course restore [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25698 moodle: Teacher is able to unenrol users without permission using course restore [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25698 moodle: Teacher is able to unenrol users without permission using course restore

long_desc.thetext:
Users' enrolment capabilities were not being sufficiently checked when they restored into an existing course,  could lead to them unenrolling users without having permission to do so.

Versions affected: 3.5 to 3.5.14, 3.7 to 3.7.8, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.9 to 3.9.2 and earlier unsupported versions

Created moodle tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: epel-all [bug 1899532]
Affects: fedora-all [bug 1899533]

This CVE Bugzilla entry is for community support informational purposes only as it does not affect a package in a commercially supported Red Hat product. Refer to the dependent bugs for status of those individual community products.

The ability for a teacher to unenroll users without permission using course restore raises concerns about privacy and user autonomy. Similar to writing for nurse from https://www.nursingpaper.com/, where informed consent is valued, respecting individuals' rights is essential in educational settings. Safeguards must be in place to prevent unauthorized unenrollments, ensuring a fair and inclusive learning environment where users' participation and progress are valued and protected.

We are getting a similar error in our system where the teacher can delete without permission. I tried several commands from their suggested list and overall it almost works. But I still get the problem if Fedora uses Flatpaks updates. Some students had to turn to https://edubirdie.com/assignment-help because the teacher deleted their course. This will work as a temporary solution, but permanently, some corrections will need to be made. I tried revising the permissions and user roles configuration, but it didn't help.

System error allowing unauthorized deletion by teachers remains unresolved in Fedora with Flatpaks updates. Commands from suggested list partially effective. Still facing the date issue in https://www.expertsmind.com/questions-answers/archive.aspx. Seems to happen specifically when Flatpaks updates are involved.

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25699 moodle: Privilege escalation within a course when restoring role overrides [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25699 moodle: Privilege escalation within a course when restoring role overrides [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25699 moodle: Privilege escalation within a course when restoring role overrides

long_desc.thetext:
Insufficient capability checks could lead to users with the ability to course restore adding additional capabilities to roles within that course.

Versions affected:  3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.7 to 3.7.8, 3.5 to 3.5.14 and earlier unsupported versions

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25700 moodle: Some database module web services did not respect group settings [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25700 moodle: Some database module web services did not respect group settings [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25700 moodle: Some database module web services did not respect group settings

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25701 moodle: tool_uploadcourse creates new enrol instances unexpectedly in some circumstances [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25701 moodle: tool_uploadcourse creates new enrol instances unexpectedly in some circumstances [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25701 moodle: tool_uploadcourse creates new enrol instances unexpectedly in some circumstances

long_desc.thetext:
If the upload course tool was used to delete an enrolment method which did not exist or was not already enabled, the tool would erroneously enable that enrolment method. This could lead to unintended users gaining access to the course.

Versions affected: 3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5, 3.7 to 3.7.8, 3.5 to 3.5.14 and earlier unsupported versions

Acknowledgments:

Name: Víctor Déniz Falcón

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=413939

bugs.title: CVE-2020-25703 moodle: The participants table download feature did not respect the site's "show user identity" configuration [fedora-all]

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2020-25703 moodle: The participants table download feature did not respect the site's "show user identity" configuration [fedora-all]

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2020-25703 moodle: The participants table download feature did not respect the site's "show user identity" configuration

long_desc.thetext:
The participants table download always included user emails, but should have only done so when
users' emails are not hidden.

Versions affected: 3.9 to 3.9.2, 3.8 to 3.8.5 and 3.7 to 3.7.8

Name: A. Schenkel

External References:

https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=413941
